text: Hazel W. Johnson-Brown (October 10, 1927 â€“ August 5, 2011) a member of the United States military. She was the 16th Chief of the United States Army Nurse CorpsJohnson-Brown, Hazel. "Brig. Gen. Hazel Johnson Brown-16th Chief, Army Nurse Corps" Army Women's Foundation. Retrieved 2021-15-12. and the first African American woman to hold the title of Brigadier general. She served the military as a nurse from 1955 to 1983 when she retired. The title of Brigadier general and 16th Chief of Army Nurse Corps was awarded to Hazel W. Johnson- Brown in 1979. == Early life == She was born on October 10, 1927. She was born and raised in Pennsylvania, United States. She is the daughter of Clarence L. Johnson Sr. and Gamett Henly Johnson. She had six siblings. It is said that she wanted to be a nurse from early childhood. == References == Category:1927 births Category:2011 deaths Category:American nurses Category:African-American military personnel Category:People from Pennsylvania Category:United States Army
title: Hazel W. Johnson-Brown
